verses.text: In thee, O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, do I put my trust ; let me never be ashamed : deliver me in thy righteousness. \q1
Bow down thine ear to me; deliver me speedily : be thou my strong rock , for an house of defence to save me.\f + \fr 31.2 \ft my…: Heb. to me for a rock of strength\f* \q1
For thou \add art\add* my rock and my fortress ; therefore for thy name’s sake lead me, and guide me. \q1
Pull me out of the net that they have laid privily for me: for thou \add art\add* my strength. \q1
Into thine hand I commit my spirit : thou hast redeemed me, O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God of truth. \q1
I have hated them that regard lying vanities : but I trust in the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*. \q1
I will be glad and rejoice in thy mercy : for thou hast considered my trouble ; thou hast known my soul in adversities ; \q1
And hast not shut me up into the hand of the enemy : thou hast set my feet in a large room. \b \q1
Have mercy upon me, O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, for I am in trouble : mine eye is consumed with grief , \add yea\add*, my soul and my belly. \q1
For my life is spent with grief , and my years with sighing : my strength faileth because of mine iniquity , and my bones are consumed. \q1
I was a reproach among all mine enemies , but especially among my neighbours , and a fear to mine acquaintance : they that did see me without fled from me. \q1
I am forgotten as a dead man out of mind : I am like a broken vessel.\f + \fr 31.12 \ft a broken…: Heb. a vessel that perisheth\f* \q1
For I have heard the slander of many : fear \add was\add* on every side : while they took counsel together against me, they devised to take away my life. \q1
But I trusted in thee, O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: I said , Thou \add art\add* my God. \q1
My times \add are\add* in thy hand : deliver me from the hand of mine enemies , and from them that persecute me. \q1
Make thy face to shine upon thy servant : save me for thy mercies’ sake. \q1

Let me not be ashamed , O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; for I have called upon thee: let the wicked be ashamed , \add and\add* let them be silent in the grave.\f + \fr 31.17 \ft silent…: or, cut off for\f* \q1
Let the lying lips be put to silence ; which speak grievous things proudly and contemptuously against the righteous.\f + \fr 31.18 \ft grievous…: Heb. a hard thing\f* \b \q1
\add Oh\add* how great \add is\add* thy goodness , which thou hast laid up for them that fear thee; \add which\add* thou hast wrought for them that trust in thee before the sons of men ! \q1
Thou shalt hide them in the secret of thy presence from the pride of man : thou shalt keep them secretly in a pavilion from the strife of tongues. \q1
Blessed \add be\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: for he hath shewed me his marvellous kindness in a strong city.\f + \fr 31.21 \ft strong: or, fenced\f* \q1
For I said in my haste , I am cut off from before thine eyes : nevertheless thou heardest the voice of my supplications when I cried unto thee. \q1

O love the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, all ye his saints : \add for\add* the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* preserveth the faithful , and plentifully rewardeth the proud doer. \q1
Be of good courage , and he shall strengthen your heart , all ye that hope in the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
